data.author: walteregli

changelog.release_notes:
v1.9: 
-Display not centered on pebble round (chalk) should be solved.
Error during drawing then moon phase
Build for pebble steel, pebble time and pebble round
Fix craching during drawing moon phase.

A drawing of the moon phase, according the difference of the right ascension (RA) of the moon and the sun, will be included in the first picture together with the moon slope ascending descending curve.
The second derivative d was not printed correct if the value d is < 0.1 Correction in presenting the floating point number d in the moon data section.

In this release the declination of the moon in time will be shown as a graph by pushing the center button.
The graph will be calculated locally in the pebble as the other coordinates for the sun and the moon.
The current day in the graph is the thick where the moon is presented as a small circle.

Correction in numerical value of derivatives.
Currently the first derivative of declination to time is normalized to (degree/day).
The second derivative of declination to time is normalized to (degree/(day*day))

1.1 Update and correcting derivative values. The first derivative from declination to time will be normalized to degree/hour and printed after the word Ascending / Descending obsigänd / nidsigänd word.
The second derivative from declination to time² will be normalized to degree /hour². 
The down bottom will show the MOON data. The select bottom (in the center) will give small navigation hints.

First release. All the calculation is done locally in pebble ( no link to internet is needed). The button in the middle on the right side of the pebble watch will show the position of the moon in astronomical coordinates (RA,DEC). If the current declination does increase (ascending moon) we call it in Swiss German (obsigend) if it is in the descending it is called (nidsigend), the descending moon. The value d is the second derivative of the slope. To get suns position (RA,DEC) click the upper bottom on the right of the pebbel. Especially the difference of the RA values shows moons phase. 12 hour full moon, 6 hour first quarter, 18 hour third quarter and 0 hour new moon. Remark: In a next release and if needed the accuracy of the object positions could be improved, now in the order of a few minutes, to less than one minute.

data.description:
Moon Ascending Descending Slope.
All the calculation is done locally in pebble ( no link to internet is needed). The moon declination slope will shown as a real calculated graph in pebble by pressing the center button. The ticks on the time axis are in units of day. The ticks on the declination axis are in units of degree. The down button on the right side of the pebble watch will show the position of the moon in celestial coordinates (RA,DEC). If the current declination does increase (ascending moon) we call it in Swiss German (obsigänd) if it is in the descending it is called (nidsigänd), the descending moon. The numerical value on the right is the first derivative of the declination to the time (degree/day). The value d is the second derivative of the declination to the time (degree/(day*day)). To get suns position (RA,DEC) click the upper bottom on the right of the pebbel. The difference of the RA values are representative for the moon phase, as example 12 hour full moon, 0 hour new moon. 
A drawing of the moon phase, according the difference of the right ascension (RA) of the moon and the sun, will be included in the first picture together with the moon slope ascending descending curve.
Remark: In a next release and if needed the accuracy of the object positions could be improved, now in the order of a few minutes, to less than one minute.

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.9: 
-Display not centered on pebble round (chalk) should be solved.

data.title: Moon Ascending Descending
